messages: c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:36): are there any admins of the whatwg blog online?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:39): c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef: here - just looking at your post in fact
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:39): cool

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:40): c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef: looks good, just change the <br/><br/> stuff to <p>s so people don't poke fun at us for using <br> when the spec says not to :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:40): oh and remove the &nbsp; at the end
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:41): i think WP did that on it's own. Cause I used the editor
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:41): ah ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:41): is there some way to change the markup that you can see?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:41): i can't see how to switch to it, it seems to be the default for me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:42): let me know if you can't, and i can do it
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:44): yah, there is a html tab
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:45): i was fixing it, but noticed someone else was editing it simultaneously. heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): if it said "ian hickson" or "admin" was editing it that's cos i was logged in and looking at it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:46): i noticed it said anne had touched it recently but i thought he was off on some faraway island or something
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (05:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I'm not sure South America (somewhere) counts as a faraway island. :)
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:49): heh, well post markup fixd :D
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:51): worst part is the wysiwyg editor in wp auto added xhtml style br tags, lol
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:51): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: it's an island far from you, isn't it? :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:52): c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:52): cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:52): tries to remember how to log into the blog again
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:53): http://blog.whatwg.org/wp-login.php
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:53): yeah i found it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:56): man i really should let the experts do this
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:56): fights with wordpress :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:56): you should now have the right to publish your post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): hopefully i didn't break anything in the process
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (05:57): cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (05:57): logs out quickly to limit the damage he can cause :-P
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (06:00): heh, alright. Blog entry published. good deal
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (06:00): thx
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:01): thank _you_!
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (06:02): well 12am where I am. + Work bright and early = Bed Time.
c86e0ba77a9bccd8e89da5b7651021ef (06:02): nn guys :D
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:17): hi everyone
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:20): just returned from 2 weeks in no-internet-land
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:23): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, come on, australia has internet
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:23): in places
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:23): a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3: unfortunately, those places do not include Uluru or the Coral Sea
a3f19f90edf0a0893c7847d08016abe3 (06:24): ah, nice! never been there myself.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:24): (both very nice places, despite the lack of internet and high concentration of deadly flora and fauna)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:34): nessy: yt?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:34): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: yay, you returned!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:34): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: did you see the sky at night at Uluru?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:34): hey there 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:34): I even brought an iPad star chart app so I could identify the stars
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:35): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: that's the most beautiful skyscape i've ever seen
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:35): spotting the milky way, the southern cross and orion was easy
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:35): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: (only place i've ever been with no other lights)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:35): but I am not sure I would have identified the Magellanic Clouds otherwise
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:35): cool
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:36): GPS / accelerometer based star chart is so win
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): google sky, or something else?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): google sky is pretty sweet
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): haven't played with it much though
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:36): it was one called RedShift
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): ah, cool
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): haven't seen that one
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:36): (and my girlfriend had Sky Walk)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:36): I hadn't heard of Google Sky
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:36): it's basically the opposite of google earth
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:37): on the desktop it's just a subfeature of earth
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:37): on mobile it's a separate app
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:38): doesn't seem to exist for iOS, unless it has a non-obvious name
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:38): ah, yeah, might not be on iOS
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:38): it's probably a 20% project
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:39): so it probably just runs on the platform that whoever wrote it uses :-)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:40): anyway, you definitely can't find a place with that little light pollution anywhere in california
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:40): yeah no kidding
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:41): other than the middle of the ocean, you'd probably be hardpressed anywhere
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (06:41): i doubt anywhere in europe is anywhere like that for instance
041f18d4e2e27cd97f4404c2c67cb362 (06:43): lapland maybe
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:48): I've previously noticed that just about any place in Australia that is far from major cities has a good night sky view
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (06:48): I would be there are places in Alaska or Canada that are far enough
